Your responsibilities As a part of our team, you will: • Apply knowledge of methodology and practices of social science research. • Work with cross-functional team members to define and prioritize research and develop UX metrics. • Conduct empirical research to identify and extract meaningful patterns of user behavior. Generate user experience insights that will help drive product improvements. • Job Requirements Your skills and experience • Currently a candidate for a Master's, Bachelor's degree, or Diploma in Human Psychology, Human-Centered Design, Anthropology, Sociology, or a related field with an accredited school in Canada. • Experience working across disciplines with designers, engineers, developers, and product teams • Experience in applied product research and design thinking techniques is an asset. A user-focused approach to research is essential. • Strong ability to communicate research findings and present suggestions in clear and engaging ways. Experience in moderating qualitative research. • It would be nice if you also had:? • User experience tools & skills, such as Figma, and design thinking skills. • A portfolio of work you've done that demonstrates the research methods that you learned about user needs while conducting the research.
